alert.note: Alert for Eastern Douglas County Foothills (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued November 28 at 2:15PM PST until December 01 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON ABOVE 2500 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON ABOVE 3000 FEET... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory above 2500 feet, periods of moderate snow showers. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. For the Winter Storm Watch above 3000 feet, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 10 inches possible above 3000 feet and locally 10 to 18 inches above 4000 feet. * WHERE...The advisory includes the Eastern Douglas County Foothills above 2500 feet and areas along Highway 138 near Toketee Falls and higher. The winter storm watch includes the Eastern Douglas County Foothills above 3000 feet and areas east of Toketee Falls. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 4 PM PST this afternoon. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Wednesday morning through Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions this afternoon. During the winter storm watch period, travel could be very difficult to impossible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heaviest snow is expected Wednesday evening through Thursday morning. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * Stock emergency kit with tire chains, flashlight, batteries, blankets, food, water, and medications. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * Plan now to avoid traveling during the storm. * A Winter Storm Watch means there is potential for snow accumulations that may create dangerous travel.
